page.title: 16Housing
page.content: There are more old houses in this rural area than new ones, there are no post war houses in Alderley, Lower Kilcott or Wortley, although many have been rennovated. In the area as a whole 46% were built before 1800, another 24% are pre 1900 and 24% are post second world war. Most of the older houses are detatched, as are some newer properties. 54% of the houses are detatched, 20% are semi- detatched, 14% terraced and there are a few odd bungalows and cottages. The newer houses have mostly been built of stone to blend into their rural setting. 66% of the houses are built of stone, 16% are brick, 12% are both brick and stone, whilst 6% are concrete block, rendered. Most roofs are tiled others are stone or slate. Most houses are heated by coal and wood, many use electricity and oil.
